Class RandomUtils

extends Object
    Static utilities for randomization

    • Method Detail

      • nextString

        public static String nextString(@NotNull
                                @NotNull String charsString,
                                int length)
        Create a random string with the provided characters. It will loop getting random characters from the charsString until it reaches the provided length
        Parameters:
        charsString - the provided characters
        length - the length of the new string
        Returns:
        the randomly generated string

      • nextString

        public static String nextString(int length)
        Create a random string with letters and numbers using nextString(String, int) and providing LETTERS, LOWER_LETTERS and NUMBERS
        Parameters:
        length - the length of the new string
        Returns:
        the randomly generated string

      • nextInt

        public static int nextInt(int min,
                          int max)
        Get an integer inside a bound. The bound is created as follows:

        i = ((max - min) + 1) + min

        Parameters:
        min - the minimum number of the bound
        max - the maximum number of the bound
        Returns:
        the random generated integer inside the bounds

      • nextDouble

        public static double nextDouble(double min,
                                double max)
        Get a double inside a bound. The bound is created as follows:

        i = min + ((1 + max - min) * Math.random());

        Parameters:
        min - the minimum double of the bound
        max - the maximum double of the bound
        Returns:
        the random generated double inside the bounds

      • nextDoubleFloor

        public static double nextDoubleFloor(double min,
                                     double max)
        This method uses nextDouble(double, double) but Math.floor(double) the result
        Parameters:
        min - the minimum double of the bound
        max - the maximum double of the bound
        Returns:
        the random generated and Math.floor(double) double inside the bound.

      • nextStringLetters

        public static String nextStringLetters(int length)
        Create a random string only using letters using nextString(String, int) and providing LETTERS and LOWER_LETTERS
        Parameters:
        length - the length of the new string
        Returns:
        the randomly generated string

      • nextStringUpper

        public static String nextStringUpper(int length)
        Create a random string only using nextString(String, int) and providing LETTERS
        Parameters:
        length - the length of the new string
        Returns:
        the randomly generated string

      • nextStringLower

        public static String nextStringLower(int length)
        Create a random string only using nextString(String, int) and providing LOWER_LETTERS
        Parameters:
        length - the length of the new string
        Returns:
        the randomly generated string

      • getRandom

        @NotNull
public static <O> O getRandom(@NotNull
                                        @NotNull Set<O> set)
        Get a random element from a set. It will convert the set into an Array List and the get a random integer inside the bounds of the set size.
        Type Parameters:
        O - the type of the elements from the set
        Parameters:
        set - the set to get the element
        Returns:
        the randomly selected element
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the set is empty

      • getRandom

        @NotNull
public static <O> O getRandom(@NotNull
                                        @NotNull List<O> list)
        Get a random object inside a list. It will get a random integer inside the bounds of the array list size.
        Type Parameters:
        O - the type of the elements from the list
        Parameters:
        list - the list to get the element
        Returns:
        the randomly selected element
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the array list is empty

      • getRandom

        @NotNull
public static <O> @NotNull List<O> getRandom(@NotNull
                                                       @NotNull List<O> list,
                                                       int amount)
        Get the amount of randomly selected elements. Using getRandom(List) getting elements to add in a new ArrayList
        Type Parameters:
        O - the type of the elements from the list
        Parameters:
        list - the list to get the elements
        amount - the amount of elements to get
        Returns:
        the randomly selected elements
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the provided list is empty or the amount is bigger than the elements inside the list

      • getRandom

        @NotNull
public static @NotNull Random getRandom()
        Get the Random object used for the generation of randomness for this utility
        Returns:
        the object
